storyInfo: An artist's dreams end following a Catastrophe. Tsukinogi stays to tell him where he can go from here.

attributes.content: There! My room's right there!
Faster, for heaven's sake!
The Catastrophe is near, sir. Please make haste.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Don't rush me! I know where my art supplies are. We can go as soon as I grab them!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: They're right under the shelf...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: They're gone!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: They were right here! Where did they go?!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: How much of a hurry were they in?! They knocked my things over!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: They ruined a great work of art! Criminals!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Calm down. Does anyone else live here?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: The landlady... Frau Perry. A housewife who knows nothing of art. She couldn't tell the sunset from an egg in the frypan.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Check the list to see if they have been evacuated.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Roger.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I hardly ever spoke to her. Do I even have her contact information?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Mr. Devlin, you just got a new message on your communicator. Here.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: 'Herr Devlin, since you were away, I packed your things into a suitcase at the door, so you can take them and evacuate as soon as you return.'
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: 'Be safe. —Perry'
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Thank goodness! What a saint!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Is that everything then? I'll place them in the truck.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Yes. Let's go.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Thank goodness, I can paint on the way.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Let's go.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Roger.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Give me some room to paint!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Sir, try not to sit like that. You could fall off.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Oh no! My brushes! My paints!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I knew I shouldn't have trusted that stupid woman!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: The canvas is ruined! The brushes have been soaked in paint! All the paint is mixed up! It's all useless now!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: It's just a painting. You'll get another chance.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: No... there will never be another chance!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I've chased Catastrophes for so long, all for the moment when I could capture one's majesty with my own canvas and brush...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Sir...
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: My painting, my dream, my life, everything... gone.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Leave me alone!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Didn't you hear me? I said to leave me alone!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: What time do you think it is?! The sun's already setting!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I don't need counselling! I'm not dead! Piss off!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: This is my last warning. Knock one more time, and I'll—
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Oh... it's you.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Good evening, Mr. Devlin.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Er, good evening... You were the one who forecasted the Catastrophe... Er... something-Island?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Rhodes Island. I'm an operator from Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...Oh, er, that's it?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I introduced myself when we first we met. Don't tell me you've forgotten my name, after we've spent this entire trip together?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: O-Of course not. You're... you're...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Tsukinogi!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I'm glad I made an impression on you after all.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Anyway, I have a few questions for you. I apologize if I'm interrupting anything.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Are you feeling any better?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...Thanks to you folks. Not that I was injured to begin with.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Good to hear. What about in terms of mental health? Anything we can help you with?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Well, my painting's done for. Couldn't get any worse on that end.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I see. Are you having any difficulties living at the accommodation site? You seem to have declined all visitors.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Difficulties... If I had to say, it would be great if my 'friendly' neighbors stopped bothering me.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I'm not registering for anything, I'm not interested in any 'Post-Catastrophe Mutual Aid Group', I don't want to see anybody's long faces, and I especially don't want to be made to answer pointless questions at my own door.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Is that all then?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I'm not here to make you uncomfortable. If you want me to stop, just say so.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...Don't you Catastrophe Messengers leave as soon as the Catastrophe's over? Why are you still here?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Have you ever met any others?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Er... no, only read about them in books.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: There are many kinds of Catastrophe Messengers. Some take an interest in things other than their jobs. Others simply quit.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: As for me, I have my reasons for staying. For example, I've taken an interest in your situation.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...Spare me. There are plenty of others who'd prefer your attention. I hear crying outside every night.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: That was simply one of many reasons. Maybe it's the scenery that keeps me here.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: There are plenty of sights worth seeing; for example, a hill with beautiful sunsets.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Perhaps that might interest a disciple of the great Leithanian landscape artist Leon... a prodigy who devoted his life to the pursuit of light and shadow.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: You looked into my background?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: What art lover wouldn't know a thing or two about the greats?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: The landscape that you left behind before you left Leithanien... The refined touches capturing the moment when the sunset fades away... It was most impressive.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...Rubbish. It couldn't compare to the beauty of a Catastrophe. Nothing could.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Painting aside, seeing beautiful sights can still help soothe one's mind. If you're interested—
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I'm not. I won't be going.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I appreciate that you and your colleagues helped me escape the Catastrophe, but that doesn't change the fact that my painting was ruined.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: If you were just a little quicker, a little more decisive in driving away those rioters...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Maybe I could have made it back and saved my supplies before Frau Perry 'packed' them for me.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: So I don't need your concern. Do whatever you want, just don't bother me.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I sincerely hope this is the last time I see you, Ms. Tsukinogi.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Regardless, it was a pleasure to meet you, Mr. Devlin.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Incidentally, I do have a little gift for you before I leave.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: This isn't part of the job, just a token from one art lover to another. I hope you can accept it.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I'll leave it here then. I wish you a good evening.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: There is no color on the blank canvas, only shadows.
He gazes at their swaying edges.
There, light and shadow break apart like the void.
He lashes out, knocking over the easel.
I can't paint...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Damn it, I can't paint!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: The Catastrophe's magnificent, beautiful song of light and shadow, that ensemble of colors... it will never come again.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: What is there to paint if I can't even pick up my brush?!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Her gift...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Art supplies, paint... clearly meant as compensation.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: How did she even know that I used this brand of paint? I never mentioned it in interviews... Did she deduce it from the paintings?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Nothing of value though... I shouldn't have expected much.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Hm? A Higashinese wood print?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: It's a landscape...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I've never seen this technique before... the lines are highly expressive.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: The colors are bold, almost sacrilegious... but the effect is interesting.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: There's something to be said about this method...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: It's getting late.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: There's been less crying at night lately.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Is the woman who left me that print still here?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I'm busy! Hold on!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I'm coming! Stop knocking!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I believe I said I wasn't going to your 'Relocation Festival'—
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Good evening, Mr. Devlin. We meet again.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Feeling any better?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Your complexion seems brighter. I take it you've been sleeping well.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Why did you come here? I told you—
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Now, it won't do to dig up a lady's shame, would it?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: You said you were busy? Have you been painting?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...Just trying out a new technique.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: That's good to hear.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I don't have any questions for you today. Instead, I brought you something. Here.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Flowers?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Yes, I picked them from that hill I mentioned, at around dusk. They still carry the dew on them.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Ordinary flowers, bland colors, unrefined forms... there's no beauty here. They're worthless.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Oh, I didn't bring them for you to admire.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I would like to ask that you paint a still life of them.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: And why would I ever paint something so mundane?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Did you enjoy those Higashinese prints?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I grew up in Higashi. When I went into town with my family, I often saw artists lined up before the great manors, presenting their proudest works to the master of the house.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I had the chance to see many fine paintings, and learned a thing or two about art appreciation.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I picked a few to bring with me when I left Higashi, but admiring art by oneself can be so dull. All the better if they could help someone else in need.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Don't you agree?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...Give me the flowers. I'll paint them.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Now what?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Since I'm the one commissioning, perhaps I should lay them out myself.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: It's messy inside...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: And it's cold outside. Would you rather keep chatting here?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...Come in.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Well, you certainly weren't exaggerating when you said it was messy.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I don't see any room for the flowers.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: They handed out a lot of useless supplies. I didn't want to waste time cleaning up when it's just a temporary place anyway.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: That won't do. A comfortable environment helps one feel at ease, which is crucial for painting.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Let me help you clean up. For the sake of the painting.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: There's no need for that.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Hm, where should I start?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: What's all this over here?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Don't touch that! I'll do it myself!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: 20 minutes later.
Just... put that stack of sketch paper over there.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: See, that wasn't so bad, was it? This place is finally fit for habitation.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: What a bother... Oh.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: The facing of the canvas, the height of the easel, and the position of the flowers...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I caught a glimpse of your room when I went in with you that day. It was very tidy.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I restored it from memory. You didn't take the still life of the flowers hanging on the wall, so I put these where it was.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Do you feel uncomfortable with anything?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: No... it looks just like before the Catastrophe...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: This is what I saw when I turned on the lights after coming back from practice every night... Sometimes I could smell Frau Perry making her soup downstairs.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I never had any, but... it feels warm and fuzzy.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I hope it makes you comfortable.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: But... I never saw these sketches in your room.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I gave them to Frau Perry to dispose of. I didn't expect her to pack them into the suitcase.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Ha. That's how my supplies got ruined. All to save these worthless sketches.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: May I have a look?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Suit yourself. Just practice sketches, barely above scrap paper.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: There are some beautiful landscapes here. Hills, cliffs, meadows... and the setting sun at dusk.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Frau Perry probably thought the same as you. 'Oh, how nice.' So she ruined everything.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Not at all. The depiction of the sunset in these sketches far surpasses the painting that you left at the academy.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Worthless.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: ...You've seen many Catastrophes, haven't you?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Then you understand that all the sunsets, all the eventides, all the sights of the world are nothing in comparison to one.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I had developed techniques never before seen in Leithanien, combining colors in beautiful and novel ways, perfectly capturing light and shadow in the moment...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: But they rejected it!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: They said it wasn't elegant enough, wasn't detailed enough... those were the pretexts they used to block me from exhibitions.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I thought I wasn't good enough, so I did everything I could to hone my skills. I didn't care about the critics. All I cared about was Herr Leon's approval.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Do you know what he said when I finally showed him the finished sunset I was so proud of?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: He said, 'Your paintings don't move me anymore.'
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Later I understood that it wasn't a matter of technique. I just wasn't meant to make this sort of painting.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: When I saw the prints you gave me yesterday, for a moment I traveled back in time, to when I would fervently try out any new technique. But I came to my senses the moment I put brush to canvas.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I couldn't do it... I couldn't paint such mundane scenery no matter how much I'd changed, because that's not what I live for.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I have the technique, all I need is a more suitable subject, something stunning, to create a true masterpiece. Then they'll understand.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: A sunset? Pah.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: The day I picked up the paintbrush, I was destined to travel this path, to dedicate my life to painting the most magnificent sight in the world—
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: A Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I appreciate all that you've done. I'll be leaving once I finish your commission.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Chasing the next Catastrophe?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: If you don't want them anymore, do you mind if I take these sketches?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: If it pleases you. Personally, I'd rather see them all burnt.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I'll take my leave then.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: What's that commotion outside?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: That scent... it's familiar...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Frau Perry's soup!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: You're up, Herr Devlin!
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: What are you doi—
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: It's the Relocation Festival! Tsukinogi's Post-Catastrophe Mutual Aid Group organized it. It's a day that everyone can relax.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: And your drawings have given the festival such an artistic bent!
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: Drawings... my drawings?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: He looks up to see threads swaying in the air.
An innumerable number of threads, linking the many sheds together.
From them hang numerous sketches, fluttering in the wind.
His sketches.
I've told you so many times that your drawings are beautiful, and people should see them, but you would never have any of it.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: I'm not sure how she convinced you, but it's wonderful that everyone gets to see them now.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: No... take them down...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: This is trash! Not art!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Why? I like your drawings...
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: You don't know the first thing about art! If they see them, they'll know just how inept they are—
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Now, I may not know much about art, but I love your drawings from the bottom of my heart.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: Besides, art isn't just for certain people.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: Wha—
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Seeing your drawings reminds me of home, the one we lost to the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: I still feel sad, of course, but your drawings are so beautiful, they make me think...
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: If we work hard to get our lives back in order, and find the time to travel around once we've settled down, maybe we could see the kind of sights we see in those drawings.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: That's impossible!
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Look around if you don't believe me.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: Did you see that one of the poplar grove? I wish we could walk through a grove like that, sit down and have a picnic...
attributes.name: Shy Woman

attributes.content: We'll find a place like that when things settle down, I promise.
attributes.name: Kind Man

attributes.content: That fried egg looks so red, dad. I'm hungry.
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: That's not an egg. It's the sun rising in the morning forest mist. It's beautiful.
attributes.name: Calm Man

attributes.content: The sun! I love the sun.
attributes.name: Mischievous Child

attributes.content: Everyone loves your drawings.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: It's been awful lately, what with having to abandon our homes and all. Everyone's having a hard time.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: Tsukinogi helped a lot, of course, she even fixed my pot. It's all thanks to her that everyone's feeling so much better.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: She planned this festival for us too. I don't know how to thank her.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: She...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: She also said I should apologize to you.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: I'm so sorry about spilling your paints when I packed your things. I've been thinking about how to make it up to you.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: Say, would you like to try some of my soup?
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: Tsukinogi... have you seen her, Frau Perry?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: She said that if you asked, I should point you to that little hill to the south of the accommodation site.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: Oh, hold on, that wasn't all.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: She also said she's not there right now. She said you'd know when to find her there, and not to forget your art supplies.
attributes.name: Frau Perry

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: You know, I think I would like a bowl of soup, please.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Make it a large one.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I see was right about the time.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: It's good to see you, Mr. Devlin.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: As I said, there's a wonderful view here.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: The great golden orb sinks towards the horizon in the distance.
It is like the heart of the day, beating futilely to keep the last light alive.
With every pulse, it sends out brilliance beyond reckoning, even as the horizon eats away at it.
But night is inexorable, inevitable.
It's beautiful, isn't it?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: There was a sunset like that, the day I left Higashi.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Why... Why did you do it?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Well, why didn't you destroy those sketches yourself?
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: ...I'm not in the habit of doing so.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Sit down, Mr. Devlin. Let me tell you a story.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Once upon a time, there was a little girl who lived in a shrine high in the mountains.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Born to an old and respected family, she was destined at birth to shoulder the clan's future. From a young age, she learned various rituals and dances, and met many important people.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: She hated all that, hated all those frivolous, superficial, impractical things.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: And so, when she grew up, she left home to become a Catastrophe Messenger.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: She used her abilities to help many people escape Catastrophe, but grew estranged from her family.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: One day, a Catastrophe struck near where she had grown up. She managed to evacuate most of the nearby residents, but her family would not leave, and refused to listen to her.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: That was when she realized that she didn't know how to talk to them.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Strange, isn't it? She could convince powerful people in high places, but when it came to her own family, there was nothing she could do except watch the tragedy occur.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: A sad story.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Some people dash towards their dreams, never stopping to look around them.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: The sunset is not a Catastrophe, but neither is one superior to the other. The beauty of the sight lies in whether or not the traveler notices it.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Stop to look around you, once in a while. Don't miss the here and now.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I... I remember now.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I was just a child who loved to draw back then. I would go to the best location in the tavern to sketch the sunset every day at dusk... the feathers dropping from fowlbeasts returning late, the long shadows cast by people in the twilight.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: The workers loved to watch me draw over a drink, laughing that the sunset looked like a fried egg. I said I would draw it even better.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I never threw away those sketches. They were put up on the tavern's walls, and customers would drop a few coins to take home the ones they liked...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: I was happy back then.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Then one day, Herr Leon stood behind me as I drew, and he said...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: 'My boy, your drawing has moved my heart.'
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: ...So that's what it was.
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: But can I still draw like that?
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: With eyes that have gazed too long upon Catastrophes, hands that cannot pick up a paintbrush...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: Don't forget that you still owe me a painting.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Let's make it now.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Devlin

attributes.content: You can paint me dancing.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Her slender form dances in the fading light, whirling with eventide.
Brush touches canvas, capturing the instant in eternity.
Spectacular job, Tsukinogi. This group just set a new record for post-evacuation satisfaction levels, and the results of the psychological assessments are extremely positive.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: This will make subsequent relocation much easier. Hopefully, they'll adjust well to life in the nomadic cities.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Good to hear.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Is this why you always stay behind afterward? To help people escape the shadow of Catastrophe and set their sights on their new lives?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Of course. Life goes on, even after the danger has passed. It's important to move on with the right mindset.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: I heard you even helped a painter finish a new work that's earned the praise of Leon, that famous Leithanian artist.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: It's stunned the Leithanian art scene, because Master Leon hasn't reviewed a work of art in over a decade.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Word has it that the painter already has several solo exhibitions lined up.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: He was always a talented artist.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Don't play dumb. What new 'little girl' story did you come up with this time?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Have a guess.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: You're asking the impossible... All I know for sure is that you made it sound real.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I have to wonder, though... what made you choose to stay behind after a Catastrophe for the first time?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: I just hate sadness, that's all.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Anyway, time's a-wasting. There's a mission waiting for us.
attributes.name: Tsukinogi

attributes.content: Hah, don't worry, you'll have plenty to do.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator
